Package entities.trees

Class TDP_Problem_Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.trees.TDP_Problem_Instance
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance, TDP_Star_Equijoin_Instance, TDP_Thetajoin_Instance
    public abstract class TDP_Problem_Instance
extends Object
    An instance of a T-DP problem realized as a multi-stage graph of state-nodes where the stages are organized in a tree structure. The edges between those nodes specify the dependencies between them. There is a starting node and mutiple terminal nodes (the leaves of the tree). The terminal node is not explicitly materialized - we assume that all the nodes of the last stage reach it with no cost. A solution to the T-DP problem is a tree from the source node to the terminal nodes. We assume that the stages are indexed consistently with the tree order, i.e., if Si has child Sj then j > i. This is an abstract class that captures all T-DP problems. An implementing subclass has to initialize the stages and the nodes by providing an implementation for the abstract method bottom_up(). This method has to:
    • Instantiate nodes as TDP_State_Node objects.
    • Set a single node as starting_node.
    • Set a number of nodes as terminals (those that belong to leaf stages).
    • Define the tree structure by using #add_stage_to_tree.
    • Instantiate weighted edges between them as TDP_Decision.
    • Compute the minimum achievable weight per node.

    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private List<Integer> branch_index
      An auxiliary data structure that stores the index of a stage as a branch from its parent For example stage 2 could have 3 children stages: 5, 6, 7.
      private List<Integer> parents
      An auxiliary data structure that encodes the tree with reverse edges, i.e., it gives us the parent of each stage (its index).
      private List<List<Integer>> stage_tree
      The T-DP states are partitioned in stages organized in a tree.
      int stages_no
      The number of stages of the T-DP problem.
      TDP_State_Node starting_node
      Single source node located at stage 0.

    • Field Detail

      • starting_node

        public TDP_State_Node starting_node
        Single source node located at stage 0.

      • stages_no

        public int stages_no
        The number of stages of the T-DP problem. Includes the starting stage (but not the terminal ones).

      • stage_tree

        private List<List<Integer>> stage_tree
        The T-DP states are partitioned in stages organized in a tree. This is represented as an adjacency list. Every stage has a unique index and the list element with that index gives us the indexes of its children.

      • parents

        private List<Integer> parents
        An auxiliary data structure that encodes the tree with reverse edges, i.e., it gives us the parent of each stage (its index).

      • branch_index

        private List<Integer> branch_index
        An auxiliary data structure that stores the index of a stage as a branch from its parent For example stage 2 could have 3 children stages: 5, 6, 7. Then the branch index of 6 is 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TDP_Problem_Instance

        public TDP_Problem_Instance()
        Creates a new problem instance by constructing all states.

    • Method Detail

      • bottom_up

        public void bottom_up()
        Goes through all states bottom-up in the tree order, while computing the minimum achievable cost and the best decision per state. After the bottom-up phase, the optimal cost is the minimum achievable cost from starting_node. The solution can be reconstructed by going top-down and following best decisions.

      • compute_opt_cost

        private void compute_opt_cost​(TDP_State_Node node)
        Recursively computes the optimal achievable cost starting from some specific node. The computed cost is stored inside the node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node we start from.
        See Also:
        entities.paths.TDP_State_Node#opt_cost

      • count_solutions

        public BigInteger count_solutions()
        Computes the total number of T-DP solutions to the problem instance. These are trees that begin at the starting node and end at terminal nodes.
        Returns:
        BigInteger The number of solutions.

      • compute_no_solutions

        private BigInteger compute_no_solutions​(TDP_State_Node node,
                                        Map<TDP_State_Node,​BigInteger> counts)
        Recursively computes the total number of solutions starting from some specific node. The computed cost is stored in a map passed in each call as an argument so that we don't have to recompute it.
        Parameters:
        node - The node we start from.
        counts - A map containing the counts for all the nodes that we have called this method on.
        Returns:
        long The total number of T-DP solutions starting from node.

      • add_parent_stage_to_tree

        protected void add_parent_stage_to_tree​(int stage,
                                        List<Integer> children_stages)
        Adds a stage to the tree structure given that all of its children stages are provided.
        Parameters:
        stage - The index of the stage to be added.
        children_stages - The indexes of its children.

                                       int parent_stage)
        Adds a stage to the tree structure by specifying its parent.
        Parameters:
        stage - The index of the stage to be added.
        parent_stage - The index of its parent.

        public int get_children_no​(int stage)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        int The number of its children stages.

      • get_children_stages

        public List<Integer> get_children_stages​(int stage)
        Parameters:
        stage - The index of a T-DP stage.
        Returns:
        List The indexes of its children stages or an empty list if it is a leaf stage.

      • get_parent_stage

        public Integer get_parent_stage​(int stage)
        Returns the parent stage of a particular stage
        Parameters:
        stage - The index of a T-DP stage.
        Returns:
        Integer The index of its parent or null for the root (0).

      • reverse_indexing

        Reverses the ordering of the stages in the tree.

      • enforce_bfs_ordering

        public void enforce_bfs_ordering()
        Reorders the stages so that their ids follow a BFS ordering in the tree.

      • print_edges

        Prints the entire constructed graph. Useful for debugging.
